gameplay

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplay.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    The Player class takes all user input and deals will all the logic related to the basic functions of bomberman, including movement, collisions, death, powerups, bombs, and pausing.

    Author:
    Leonardo Siracusa, Chady Kamar
    See Also:
    PlayerInfo, State, Game, Tile, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(Grid grid, Enemy enemy, Level level)
      Constructor that initializes a Player object which initializes the user's starting position on the map, sets its position on the frame, initializes all bomb attributes to their basic values, sets the score for the session to zero, initializes movement speed and loads the player image.

    • Field Detail

      • livesLeft

        public static int livesLeft

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(Grid grid,
              Enemy enemy,
              Level level)

        Constructor that initializes a Player object which initializes the user's starting position on the map, sets its position on the frame, initializes all bomb attributes to their basic values, sets the score for the session to zero, initializes movement speed and loads the player image. Additionally, the required game objects are initialized. A player utilizes a Grid, Enemy, and PowerUps object.

        A player object deals with the basic player movement and collisions, powerup logic, and places bomb accordingly. Additionally, all user input is taken through the player class.
        Parameters:
        grid - an object of Grid which contains the game's map and required methods access and alter it.
        enemy - an object of Enemy which contains information about the enemies on the map.
        level - an object of Level which contains the required information about the level.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()

        Move method called at every user input. Based on the key pressed, it updates the players position on the grid accordingly. This method deals with collisions, powerups, and player death.

        Move only occurs when the countForMovementSpeed is equal to the actual movement speed, which is defaulted to 2. The count is updated on each call, and is reset when the move is executed. When the player finds the movement speed power up, the movementSpeed is set to 1, and move functions on each call.

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)

        This method performs a check on if the following keys are pressed: up, down, right, left, b, space, and x. Based on the key, It then processes the required logic. .

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)

        This method performs a check on if the following keys are pressed: up, down, right, left, b, space, and x. Based on the key, It then processes the required logic. .

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Method which allows you to determine the players position on the x axis. Note: Each tile has a TILE_SIZE of 25.
        Returns:
        the int corresponding to the player's position relative to the frame's initial point along the 'x' axis.

      • setX

        public void setX(int xNew)
        Method which allows you to set the players position on the x axis.
        Parameters:
        xNew - The new position of the player along the x axis.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Method which allows you to determine the players position on the y axis. Note: Each tile has a TILE_SIZE of 25.
        Returns:
        the int corresponding to the player's position relative to the frame's initial point along the y axis.

      • setY

        public void setY(int yNew)
        Method which allows you to set the players position on the y axis.
        Parameters:

      • getImage

        public java.awt.Image getImage()
        Gets the image for the player.
        Returns:
        the Image shown when player is in a tile by itself.

      • getBombNumber

        public static int getBombNumber()

        Returns the bombNumber which keeps track of the bombs placed on the map: required for the detonate powerup logic.

        This method allows you to determine the bomb number.

        Note: bombNumber is reset when there are no bombs present on the grid.

        Returns:
        the int corresponding to the bombNumber attribute.

      • setBombNumber

        public static void setBombNumber(int bombNumber)

        Required for detonate powerup logic.

        Sets the bombNumber which keeps track of the bombs placed on the map.

        This method allows you to set the bomb number. This is primarily used in the bomb class: after the explode() method is called, it is incremented.

        Note: bombNumber is reset when there are no bombs present on the grid.

        Parameters:
        bombNumber - The number corresponding to the bomb placed on the grid. The oldest bomb should be set to 10.

      • getCurrentBombCounter

        public static int getCurrentBombCounter()

        Required for detonate powerup logic.

        Gets the counter for the integer which keeps track of the bomb number, and is passed to the new bomb object and decremented. This is cross checked with bombNumber; if they match, the bomb explodes.

        Returns:
        the int corresponding to the currentBombCounter attribute.

      • setCurrentBombCounter

        public static void setCurrentBombCounter(int currentBombCounter)

        Required for detonate powerup logic.

        Sets the counter for the integer which keeps track of the bomb number, and is passed to the new bomb object and decremented. This is cross checked with bombNumber; if they match, the bomb explodes.
        Parameters:
        currentBombCounter - The number corresponding to the bomb number.

      • toggleMovementSpeed

        public void toggleMovementSpeed()
        Method to change the Player's movement speed. As it can only be 1 or 2, (1 being the faster of the two), it only needs to be toggled.

      • getMovementSpeed

        public int getMovementSpeed()
        Method used for unit testing.
        Returns:
        an int representing movement speed.

      • setDx

        Method used for unit tested.
        Parameters:
        dx - Allows us to change dx without using keyboard inputs.
